channel.title: CVE Feed for Nvidia Corporation -- Windows GPU Display Driver
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Nvidia Corporation -- Windows GPU Display Driver

item.title: CVE-2017-0319|2024-08-05T13:03:56.620Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- windows%20gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler where improper handling of values may cause a denial of service on the system.

item.title: CVE-2017-0308|2024-08-05T13:03:56.467Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- windows%20gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgkDdiEscape where untrusted input is used for buffer size calculation leading to denial of service or escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0320|2024-08-05T13:03:56.491Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- windows%20gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler where improper handling of values may cause a denial of service on the system.

item.title: CVE-2017-0312|2024-08-05T13:03:56.640Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- windows%20gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgkDdiEscapeID 0x100008b where user provided input is used as the limit for a loop may lead to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges

item.title: CVE-2017-0324|2024-08-05T13:03:56.646Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- windows%20gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgkDdiEscape where the size of an input buffer is not validated, leading to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0322|2024-08-05T13:03:56.473Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- windows%20gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler where a value passed from a user to the driver is not correctly validated and used as the index to an array, leading to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0314|2024-08-05T13:03:56.528Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- windows%20gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) implementation of the SubmitCommandVirtual DDI (DxgkDdiSubmitCommandVirtual) where untrusted input is used to reference memory outside of the intended boundary of the buffer leading to denial of service or escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0313|2024-08-05T13:03:57.018Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- windows%20gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) implementation of the SubmitCommandVirtual DDI (DxgkDdiSubmitCommandVirtual) where untrusted input is used to reference memory outside of the intended boundary of the buffer leading to denial of service or escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0315|2024-08-05T13:03:56.383Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- windows%20gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgkDdiEscape where an attempt to access an invalid object pointer may lead to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0317|2024-08-05T13:03:56.519Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- windows%20gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of NVIDIA GPU and GeForce Experience installer contain a vulnerability where it fails to set proper permissions on the package extraction path thus allowing a non-privileged user to tamper with the extracted files, potentially leading to escalation of privileges via code execution.
